detaileddescription.para: Makes a new root and random node identity + context with random keys
NOTE: The resulting wickr_ctx_gen_result does not gain ownership over the parameters to this function

parameterdescription.para: the crypto engine to use for all context operations
the device info for which to bind this context to
a system unique identifier that will represent the root identity that is being generated

simplesect.para: a generation result containing a root identity represented by 'identifier' and a node identity signed by 'root' with a random set of keys

detaileddescription.para: Makes a new root and random node identity + context with random keys except for a provided root signing key
NOTE: The resulting wickr_ctx_gen_result does not gain ownership over the parameters to this function

parameterdescription.para: the crypto engine to use for all context operations
the device info for which to bind this context to
a signature key to associate with the generated root identity
a system unique identifier that will represent the root identity that is being generated

simplesect.para: a generation result containing a root identity represented by 'identifier' and a node identity signed by 'root' with 'sig_key' as the root signing key

detaileddescription.para: Makes a new context using an existing root keys set
NOTE: The resulting wickr_ctx_gen_result does not gain ownership over the parameters to this function
This function is used to provision a new node identity onto the system given an existing root identity

parameterdescription.para: the crypto engine to use for all context operations
the device info for which to bind this context to
the root keys to use for the generation, the generated node will be signed by the root key's signing key, and the storage keys will be derived from the root remote / local cipher keys
the system unique identifier that was previously associated with root_keys

simplesect.para: a generation result containing an existing root identity represented by 'identifier' and a node identity signed by the existing root

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_crypto_engine_t engine, wickr_dev_info_t *dev_info, wickr_buffer_t *exported_recovery_key, wickr_buffer_t *passphrase, wickr_buffer_t *recovery_data, wickr_buffer_t *identifier)
memberdef.name: wickr_ctx_gen_with_passphrase

detaileddescription.para: Makes a new context using an existing root identity's exported recovery key and a passphrase
NOTE: The resulting wickr_ctx_gen_result does not gain ownership over the parameters to this function

parameterdescription.para: the crypto engine to use for all context operations
the device info for which to bind this context to
a previously exported random recovery key that was protected with a KDF using 'passphrase' as the key. See 'wickr_ctx_gen_export_recovery_key_passphrase' for more information
the passphrase to decode exported_recovery_key with
an export of 'root_keys' from a previous context encrypted with recovery_key
identifier the system unique identifier that was previously associated with the root keys held in 'recovery'

simplesect.para: a generation result containing an existing root identity represented by 'identifier' and a node identity signed by the existing root. NULL if decoding 'exported_recovery_key' or 'recovery' fails due to an invalid passphrase

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_crypto_engine_t engine, wickr_dev_info_t *dev_info, wickr_buffer_t *recovery_data, wickr_cipher_key_t *recovery_key, wickr_buffer_t *identifier)
memberdef.name: wickr_ctx_gen_with_recovery

detaileddescription.para: Makes a new context using an existing exported root keys and a provided recovery key
NOTE: The resulting wickr_ctx_gen_result does not gain ownership over the parameters to this function

parameterdescription.para: the crypto engine to use for all context operations
the device info for which to bind this context to
an recovery containing exported root_keys from a previous context using 'recovery_key'
the key to decrypt 'recovery' with to attempt recovery of root_keys to use for context generation
identifier the system unique identifier that was previously associated with the root keys held in 'recovery'

simplesect.para: a generation result containing an existing root identity represented by 'identifier' and a node identity signed by the existing root. NULL if decoding 'recovery' fails due to an incorrect key

detaileddescription.para: Exports the recovery key using a KDF + CIPHER function
For more information on the KDF + CIPHER functionality, review documentation for 'wickr_crypto_engine_kdf_cipher'
Defaults are currently using KDF_SCRYPT_2_17 for a KDF and CIPHER_AES256_GCM for a cipher

parameterdescription.para: a context generation result to export the recovery key from
the passphrase to use as input to the KDF function

simplesect.para: a buffer that was created by first taking KDF(randomSalt || passphrase) and then using that output as a key that encrypted

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_crypto_engine_t engine, const wickr_buffer_t *exported_recovery_key, const wickr_buffer_t *passphrase)
memberdef.name: wickr_ctx_gen_import_recovery_key_passphrase

parameterdescription.para: a crypto engine that supports the KDF and cipher used to originally export an recovery key
an exported recovery key from 'wickr_ctx_gen_export_recovery_key_passphrase'
the passphrase used during the original export

simplesect.para: a decoded recovery key or NULL if the passphrase is incorrect

detaileddescription.para: Serializes root keys and ciphers them with the recovery key

parameterdescription.para: the context generation result to make an recovery from

simplesect.para: a buffer with a serialized cipher_result generated by encrypting 'root_keys' with the 'recovery_key' held in 'result'.

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_crypto_engine_t engine, const wickr_buffer_t *recovery_data, const wickr_cipher_key_t *recovery_key)
memberdef.name: wickr_ctx_gen_import_recovery

parameterdescription.para: a crypto engine that was used to call 'wickr_ctx_gen_result_make_recovery'
an encrypted recovery as created by 'wickr_ctx_gen_result_make_recovery'
the recovery key from the 'wickr_ctx_gen_result' that called 'wickr_ctx_gen_result_make_recovery' to make 'recovery'

simplesect.para: root keys created from decoding 'recovery' with 'recovery_key' or NULL if the decryption operation failed

detaileddescription.para: Copy a context generation result

parameterdescription.para: the context generation result to copy

simplesect.para: a newly allocated context generation result holding a deep copy of the properties of 'source'

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a context generation result

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the context generation result to destroy. All properties of '*result' will also be destroyed

detaileddescription.para: Create a context from components

parameterdescription.para: a crypto engine to support context operations
the device information the context should be bound to
the identity chain that belongs to this context and will be used for encoding / decoding messages
the storage keys used for local and remote ciphers of this context

simplesect.para: a newly allocated context owning the passed in parameters

detaileddescription.para: Copy a context

parameterdescription.para: the context to copy

simplesect.para: a newly allocated context holding a deep copy of the properties of 'ctx'

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a context

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the context to destroy. All properties of '*ctx' will also be destroyed

detaileddescription.para: Exports storage keys for a context using a KDF + CIPHER function
For more information on the KDF + CIPHER functionality, review documentation for 'wickr_crypto_engine_kdf_cipher'
Defaults are currently using KDF_SCRYPT_2_17 for a KDF and CIPHER_AES256_GCM for a cipher

parameterdescription.para: the context to export storage keys from
the passphrase to use as input to a KDF that will generated a key to protect storage keys

simplesect.para: a buffer containing exported storage keys

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_crypto_engine_t engine, const wickr_buffer_t *exported, const wickr_buffer_t *passphrase)
memberdef.name: wickr_ctx_import_storage_keys

detaileddescription.para: Import storage keys exported with 'wickr_ctx_export_storage_keys'

parameterdescription.para: a crypto engine supporting KDF based encryption
keys exported with 'wickr_ctx_export_storage_keys'
the passphrase used to export storage keys

simplesect.para: decoded storage keys or NULL if the passphrase is invalid

detaileddescription.para: Encrypts data using the local storage key

parameterdescription.para: the context to use for encryption
the bytes to encrypt for local storage

simplesect.para: 'plaintext' encrypted with the context's local storage key

detaileddescription.para: Decrypts data using the local storage key

parameterdescription.para: the context to use for decryption
a cipher result from 'wickr_ctx_cipher_local'

simplesect.para: 'cipher_text' decoded with local storage key

detaileddescription.para: Encrypts data using the remote storage key

parameterdescription.para: the context to use for encryption
plaintext the bytes to encrypt for remote storage

simplesect.para: 'plaintext' encrypted with the context's remote storage key

detaileddescription.para: Decrypts data using the local storage key

parameterdescription.para: the context to use for decryption
a cipher result from 'wickr_ctx_cipher_remote'

simplesect.para: 'cipher_text' decoded with remote storage key

detaileddescription.para: Generate ephemeral message keypairs

NOTE: the result of this function should be kept in a local cache to allow for decoding a message that was created with it's public components. The public buffer of the contained EC key, along with the key_id, and the key signature should be published to a pool for consumption and use by a sender looking to addresss a message to this context

parameterdescription.para: the context to use for ephemeral key pair generation
the identifier to assign to the generated keypair

simplesect.para: an ephemeral key pair containing the private and public components, signed by the ctx node signing identity

detaileddescription.para: Create a context packet parse result from components

parameterdescription.para: see property description from 'wickr_ctx_packet'
see property description from 'wickr_ctx_packet'
see property description from 'wickr_ctx_packet'

simplesect.para: a newly allocated context packet parse result owning the parameters passed in

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a packet parse result

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to a context packet parse result to destroy. Will destroy the sub properties of '*packet' as well

detaileddescription.para: Create an encode result from components

parameterdescription.para: see property description from 'wickr_ctx_encode'
see property description from 'wickr_ctx_encode'

simplesect.para: a newly allocated encode packet result owning the parameters passed in

detaileddescription.para: Destroy an encode packet result

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to an encode packet result to destroy. Will destroy the sub properties of '*encode' as well

detaileddescription.para: Encode a Wickr packet to a set of nodes

parameterdescription.para: the context to use to encode 'payload' to 'nodes'
the metadata and body information to send to 'nodes'
the recipient nodes for this packet

simplesect.para: an encode result containing an encrypted Wickr packet that transfers 'payload' to 'nodes'

detaileddescription.para: Parse a Wickr packet into components, fail if the current node's key exchange is not found

parameterdescription.para: the context to use for parsing
the buffer representing the serialized packet that was delivered to 'ctx'
the sender of the 'packet_buffer'

simplesect.para: a parse result holding the parsed information from 'packet_buffer' as well as a discovered key exchange from the current ctx node_id. If the packet was not addressed to this context, an error is generated

detaileddescription.para: Parse a packet into components, do not fail if the current node's key exchange is not found

parameterdescription.para: ctx the context to use for parsing
the buffer representing the serialized packet that was delivered to 'ctx'
the sender of the 'packet_buffer'

simplesect.para: a parse result holding the parsed information from 'packet_buffer' with a NULL key exchange

detaileddescription.para: Decode a parsed packet using the provided keypair
NOTE: this will fail if the packet was parsed using wickr_ctx_parse_packet_no_decode

parameterdescription.para: ctx the context to use for decoding
a previously parsed packet using 'wickr_ctx_parse_packet'
a key pair containing the private key associated with the identifier contained within the key exchange within the packet parse result

simplesect.para: a decode result containing an error status as well as the decoded packet payload, and the payload_key that was derived via the key exchange operations if the key pair presented is correct
